text: Hey everyone! I have a question regarding API v2 OAuth - (not sure if this is the correct place to ask this): It seems only my Admin level users can authorize an app to connect via OAuth. Other users are shown this message. Can anyone advise me as to what I may be doing wrong from either a configuration or other standpoint?
Hi <@U897Z82K0> - that notification basically means that your user account does not have the appropriate scopes required to use that integration. Which integration are you trying to access?
It's a custom integration for a custom application
The app requires the content scope and the user belongs to a Marketing Enterprise portal
Do you have the Portal ID? As well as the specific user? <@U897Z82K0>
The scopes are on a per-user basis so it’s possible they still don’t have the content scope. I can take a look but I’ll also be looping in our Developer Advocate
<@U87PC477A> User Joseph (Test) Gagliardi for portal: 4063805 (bump)
<@U22PJPGK0> I've found another case where this is happening on our page.
<https://www.modev.com/team>
I've not edited these styles for months and it looks like only half of the styles are showing up on our page now...
I switched my styles from compressed to compact and that looks like it did the trick.

I do have 30+ stylesheets that are still compressed site wide so if this is an issue it would be nice to have looked into. I'll make sure all my future styles are compact instead of compressed but it's a bit of pain coming across these old pages that were fine and now are goofed do to styles not loading correctly.
OK. Which styles are missing from the page?
I had to update the page so it is fixed now.
The styles were random through.
for instance .team-member-container styles were there but .team-member-opacity-layer was missing.
they weren’t in the CSS file at all?
I'm not sure if they were in the front-end but in the HubSpot file they were.
When I checked the element in the console they weren't present. But I didn't look at the css file in the console.
I believe in the oauth or the app you have to set the scope, so the user must be able to access that scope
If a user has access to marketing, they should be clear for the content scope of the API, no?
